title: Very rarely for sale 1962 rh drive devon camper project

posts.content:
Would you be interested in selling the interior?


Thank you

Jac
Also interested in interior if Jac does;t get there first
Sorry, I want to keep it all together.

You have to keep it together, no compromise .....
Good luck with the sale, you will sell, if I was still running my shop I'd take it in a flash, right money too.

Ron

That Caravette interior is worth a lot!
Hourglass cooker, gas light.
Rear slider cupboards.. high level cupboards in the rear table holder!
I would say that was very early 62.. if not 61. have you checked the VIN code..Build date from the mcode plate?
Very very nice. The interior is worth at least 1/3rd of your asking price..
...was worth a try
...sorry...
Thanks for your comments guys,pretty sure the interior is correct,we have done a lot of research.thanks anyway.cheers.

I am sure the interior is correct but was asking to see the dates that this interior was fitted. I am sure it is 61/ early 62 period.
I have a 62 Devonette!
If you look at my photos on the link, we have arranged the furniture as it will be fitted,( roughly) . any questions ? I'll help if I can.

Yes that may help G but he would like to know the year the wood was cut, direction of grain, thickness of lacour etc.
G is trying to tie up all interiors cut from the same tree, he's a serious Devon addict, I'm surprised he doesn't live there to smell the trees........you need to be carful of the oldie who goes around smelling stuff....

Very nice very desireable Devon..
Ron...have you sold yet?
G
